title: Why COVID-19 Vaccinations Run Far Short of ‘Warp Speed’
itunes:title: Why COVID-19 Vaccinations Run Far Short of ‘Warp Speed’
description:
Allegheny County Executive Rich Fitzgerald discusses participating in the Moderna Phase III trial, vaccine deployment, and COVID-19 recovery in Pittsburgh. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg News Technology Reporter Austin Carr talk about the story “The Cruise Ship Suicides Began After the Last Passengers Left.” James Thomson, Partner at Buy Box Experts, shares his insight on how the pandemic is affecting e-commerce. Bloomberg News U.S. Health Care Team Leader Drew Armstrong breaks down why U.S. coronavirus vaccinations at 200,000 a day run far short of `Warp Speed.' And we Drive to the Close with Ed Rosenberg, Head of ETFs at American Century Investments.

Host: Paul Sweeney. Producer: Doni Holloway.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
